comments:
I am using June 14 candidate driver.
Start profiling the InOut app using java 5

I get this exception in the console; not sure about the severity of the exception, everything seems to work fine for the first profiling session. On the second profiling session the UI hangs for a while then nothing happens ( I see no process in the Profiling monitor view )

Exception in thread "Console" java.lang.InternalError: java.security.NoSuchAlgor
ithmException: SHA MessageDigest not available
        at java.rmi.dgc.VMID.computeAddressHash(VMID.java:168)
        at java.rmi.dgc.VMID.<clinit>(VMID.java:39)
        at java.lang.J9VMInternals.initializeImpl(Native Method)
        at java.lang.J9VMInternals.initialize(J9VMInternals.java:148)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.util.Guid.getPseudoIEEE802Address(G
uid.java:474)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.util.Guid.<init>(Guid.java:269)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.FileServerCom
mandFactory.generateIdentity(FileServerCommandFactory.java:570)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.FileServerCom
mandFactory.<init>(FileServerCommandFactory.java:256)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.FileServerCom
mandFactory.<init>(FileServerCommandFactory.java:243)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.FileServerCom
mandFactory.getInstance(FileServerCommandFactory.java:186)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.FileServerCom
mandFactory.getInstance(FileServerCommandFactory.java:160)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerExtendedImpl.<init
>(FileManagerExtendedImpl.java:517)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerFactory$NewFileSer
verProvider.<init>(FileManagerFactory.java:355)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerFactory$NewFileSer
verProvider.<init>(FileManagerFactory.java:354)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.local.file.FileManagerFactory.create(Fil
eManagerFactory.java:706)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.common.Console.run(Consol
e.java:180)

I had tried again with a clean workspace and I can't actually profile the application. The process doesn't show up in the Profiling Monitor view.
Setting severity to major.

My jre details

java version "1.5.0_06"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-b05, mixed mode, sharing)
Eugene, could you please look into this?

I have seen this error message in the past.  I assume you're running AC/IAC with security enabled.  Last time, I remember it was a configuration issue on my machine.  Something was wrong either with my PATH or CLASSPATH.  I don't remember exactly what I did to resolve it.  It seems like the exception is thrown by the JVM when it's not able to find the crypto algorithm specified.  See here: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/security/MessageDigest.html#getInstance(java.lang.String)

Try switching to an IBM JVM.  If it works, checks to see the difference in the configuration of the two JVMs.
I am running with the new IAC; I checked on the AC page and the security is reported to be off ( I made no attempt to change the default settings prior to starting the profiling session )

After more investigation I realized the exception occurs with both sun and IBM jre 1.5 but only if I run with java.exe. Everything works fine when I run with javaw.exe

In other words, I can reproduce the problem if I run eclipse with a console using this command
eclipse -vm D:\ProgramFiles\Java\IBM_SDK5.0\bin\java.exe

Everything works fine if I run without a debug console, using eclipse.exe ( which by default uses javaw.exe )

I'll update severity to critical since profiling when running Eclipse with a console doesn't work
I have the same problem when running with java 1.4

(In reply to comment #4)
> I am running with the new IAC; I checked on the AC page and the security is
> reported to be off ( I made no attempt to change the default settings prior to
> starting the profiling session )
> 

It might have been a different problem I experienced then.

I have tried to reproduce the problem on 2 different machines with both IBM and SUN 1.5 JDK, and I cannot reproduce the problem as described.

Valentina also tried again on her machine and even thought exception (as in description) still shows on her console, she no longer have problem profiling, nor relaunching. Data are collected with no problem. We suspect it may be the setup of her machine's environment that triggers the problem. 


It's agreed by the originator that I will lower the severity of this bug and target post 4.4 release for now.
